channel.title: PortForwarding
channel.description: I cant portforward....when i go to the ip it wont work.....anyone help to reset it or anything?

item.title: PortForwarding
item.dc:creator: @koopa_king koopa king
item.description:
@koopa_king wrote:

Try to be more descriptive. Go to www.portforward.com . There it has a tutorial on how to portforward. If you still can get it to work, use µTorrent. Once you download µTorrent, make sure you change your preferences in the options tab. Change the Port to be connected to, to 43594 (default port), and then make sure Enable uPnP, Enable NAT-PMP, and Add Windows Firewall Exception are all checked, and the other one is not checked. Then close it, go to your task bar and exit it there too. Then run your server, and open up µTorrent again.

Hope I helped. =]

If you are still stuck about using µTorrent, send me a PM.

Read full topic
